info.desc: Mark up placeholder text that should be replaced by the user.

page.title: Variable Text
page.p: Use the var element to mark up placeholder text that should be replaced by the user. This is typically used inside a cmd or code element to indicate a replaceable argument, or within running prose to refer to an indicated argument.

item.p: The style attribute takes a space-separated list of style hints. Processing tools should adjust their rendering according to those style hints they understand.
The var element can link to other pages or documents. See for more information.
The var element can have attributes from external namespaces. See for more information on external-namespace attributes on inline elements.

section.title: Comparison to DocBook
section.p: The var element is similar to the replaceable element in DocBook.
